title: If the top two professors from each university all around the world were to come together for a project, could they make significant change in the world? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. That's not how the world changes. Professors are "teachers" and "observers", not "doers" of things. The job of intellectuals is to observe things, analyze what they observe, and describe that in a systematic way. Furthermore, it's not a matter of getting all these smart people together to solve problems. That's not the issue. In fact, they already do basically "come together" on all sorts of "projects". Scientists and other academicians get together for conferences all the time, as well as publish papers for peer review, collaborate on research, etc.  The inability of the world to solve our social problems isn't due to the logistics of getting professors and other smart people together.

The only significant change in the world will come when the people revolt en masse or when catastrophe strikes.It won't come from academia.
